text: I know this is like three years old now, but can I double click on this. I can add a second selector to the generic layout.css classes to have any grid layout I want even if it's 16 columns instead of 12?
Anyone known with this issue while connecting a private app? With a public app we don’t have this issue..

There are a few different ways what you’re saying can be interpreted.

So I apologize for this vague answer, it just covers each of the different ways I can see that question to mean.

If you can do it in CSS, yes, you can do that. You control that file.

Be aware though the page editor will not suddenly start allowing you to drag and drop items on a 16 column grid. It will still generate the same class names, you can’t control the class names generated, only the CSS that actually does something with the class names. You can also wrap the elements at the template level with a class so you can target the inner elements for styling.

So you certainly could use a 16 column grid in your modules, and templates, it’s just that the dnd area portion itself would be based on 12 columns.
